Title: Workforce development for the future grid to enable sustainable energy systems
Venue: IEEE Power & Energy Society General Meeting
Abstract summary: The paper outlines a workforce development initiative to educate the workforce needed for the future grid to enable sustainable energy systems.

Title: Energy Efficiency Industry Trends and Workforce Development in Washington State
Abstract summary: The paper discusses trends and workforce development needs in the energy efficiency industry in Washington state, driven by growth in demand for energy efficiency.

Title: Building a More Diverse, Equitable, and Inclusive Energy Efficiency Workforce
Authors: Sarah Truitt, Juliana Williams, Ardelia Clarke
Abstract summary: The paper identifies key factors for creating successful workforce development and inclusion programs to support the building industry's future.

Title: A National Skills Assessment of the U.S. Wind Industry in 2012
Abstract summary: This study provides insights into the current and projected workforce needs of the U.S. wind industry to inform workforce development decisions.

Title: An Updated Review of the Solar PV Installation Workforce Literature
Authors: Sika Gadzanku, A. Kramer, Brittany Smith
Abstract summary: This review examines the existing literature on the solar PV installation workforce, including metrics, workforce wellbeing, relevant policies, and efforts to expand workforce participation.

Title: Introduction to Workforce Development Energy Futures Grant
Abstract summary: This presentation introduces workforce development efforts to support clean energy projects funded by the Energy Futures Grant.

Title: The Power and Energy Initiative at the University of Pittsburgh: Addressing the aging workforce issue through innovative education, collaborative research, and industry partnerships
Abstract summary: The University of Pittsburgh's Power & Energy Initiative partners with industry to address the aging workforce issue in the power and energy sector through education and research.

Title: Energy Efficiency Services Sector: Workforce Education and Training Needs
Abstract summary: This paper examines the workforce education and training needs for the energy efficiency services sector.
